Did you like Portal, but not enough to seriously consider getting its sequel? That was the case with me, but I don't remember that ever stopping me from blowing money on things I don't want. Portal 2 has taught me that fiscal irresponsibility pays off! It's a great game with great writing, and unlike Portal, the aesthetics actually change from time to time. In short, this is a terrible game. I give a 9 out of 10. It's a rental at best. One of the best games of all time. (No really get this game it's fantastic.)
Amazing game. Can't wait for the next sequel!
The return of portal gone overboard. Spectacular game! Portal fans will have a blast!

All the flaws that the first Portal game had (which was mainly the short story mode) have been fixed and the fun continues in the sequel to this awesome series. The gameplay was so addicting that I played through the story in one sitting while laughing my ass off at the same time. If you are even remotely interested in puzzle games, then try this one :)

Portal 2

When Portal 1 was such a huge success, Valve put a huge production towards Portal 2. The story and feel of the game is incredible. The puzzles are fun as well with a lot more tools to play with. Looking back I think I enjoyed Portal 1's puzzles a bit more but that's probably because that was when there was no other game like it. I would buy Portal 1 before buying Portal 2 but there's no reason not to play both. They both incredible games.

Portal 2 also has co-op where you can screw your friend over for laughs.

Ah Portal 2.. Portal 2 is one of those rare games that comes around every once in a while and just blows me away. Everything about this game is perfect, the controls are super easy to understand and use, the story was deep and entertaining, the characters showed so much personality and emotion, the games soundtrack was a masterpeice, and just the gameplay itself was freaking fun as all get out! I HIGHLY recommend this any video gamer and I assure you, this game WILL NOT dissapoint you! My rating, 10/10. Amazing job Valve!
Fun game like its predecessor. Witty dialogue and great workshop editor.

Awesome! Better than the first and a must have.

Edit -  I originally played through it on the Xbox 360.
The Best!!!!
Simply Brilliant
it is awesome!
Its more portal! Not quite as tightly designed as the first game, but with much more exposition/story/writing to make up for it.  Totally worthy sequel.  (9.5/10)
awesome but very hard i'm stuck on a level!!!

A very worthy sequel to the first Portal game. Nice story, great characters, lot of humor, nice additions to the puzzles. I am glad to see that not only indie developers can achieve such a level of creativity.
The game may be a tad easy but hey, you can have your worth with the community maps.

My only complain is that you don't have the feeling that you are in a human body: you are just a floating camera with no visible arms or legs, no head bobbing. Dark Messiah of Might and Magic has implemented all these features perfectly, and it is based on the Source engine so there is no excuse for Valve.
Moreover, the character doesn't make any sound, not even a grunt after a long fall or when getting wounded. All this breaks a bit the immersion, and that's a sad thing.

Noia.
Ciao sono una patata tua amica.
Amusant !

Taking the almost tech-demo Portal 1 and making a full-fledged campaign with story and awesome voice acting, and it worked very well. Gets a little bit long in the tooth at times but it's a fantastic game and it has co-op if you wanna feel stupid WITH your friends.

[u][b]-Quick Review-[/b][/u]
Portal2 is a first person puzzle game developed by Valve and released 2011. This game was greatly anticipated when it was announced and we all waited in anticipation for the release.
The game was not a disappointment, the developers brought us back to Aperture Laboratories and put us to work on new and innovative puzzles, Portal1 and 2 will always be one of my most favorite puzzle games, period.


[u][b]-Detailed breakdown review-[/b][/u]
[b]Story:[/b] [spoiler]You wake up in a strange hotel-looking room, after awakening you discover you're actually still inside Aperture Laboratories and the whole place is falling apart! You need to find a way out and escape before the whole lab falls down around your ears![/spoiler]

[b]Gameplay:[/b] The whole game is based on the core concepts of two portals [i](an Orange/red and Blue Portal)[/i], be it moving objects through these portals, moving yourself between these portals, or jumping off high objects to reach hard to reach places, the game is a brainteaser in such a wonderful way. As the catchphrase goes “prepare to think with portals”.
There are a number of features in Portal2, there are Single player, Co-op, Community Test Chambers/Workshop, Steam Achievements, and challenge modes where you can compete against your friends for fastest times, least portals used, steps, and more. 

[b]Achievements:[/b] There are 51 Achievements for Portal2, Most of the single player achievements are straightforward fun and challenging to get... There are also Co-op achievements, so it would be best to make or get a friend to help you out.

[b]Price:[/b] Portal2 is priced at $19.99 that will be the best 20 dollars you spend. But if you're on a tight budget like me you might want to wait for a 75% off sale, since the game was released in 2011 there's a very good chance that there will be sale for it.

[b]Conclusion:[/b] I really can't sum up how great Portal2 is without saying “look, if you're even remotely interested in trying it out, you don't grasp just what an outstanding puzzle game it is. I highly recommend Portal2 to everyone and anyone.

------Edits and updates------
Edit/Update September 13, 2015:
